event.summary: 09/25/1993: A major gun battle broke out in Ulster when the IRA tried to shoot down an Army helicopter. Terrorists using heavy machine guns mounted on a flat-bed truck opened fire on a Puma helicopter as it took off from a military base at Crossmaglen. No one was injured or killed in the attack.
event.propcomment: The helicopter was hit by gunfire, but the extent of damage was not significant.
event.addnotes: The Puma was joined by two more Army helicopters and a ten-minute battle took place. The gunmen abandoned their vehicles in the village of Cullyhanna, close to the border with the Irish Republic, and hijacked several cars to escape.
event.scite1: “Terrorists Flee in Helicopter Shoot-out," Daily Mail (London), September 24, 1993.
event.scite2: “IRA Drop Guns and Flee," The Herald, September 25, 1993.
